definition: as far as one's capabilities extend (idiom); to the best of one's ability/within one's powers
surname Li
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Neng
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
and/to reach/up to/in time for

sentences.english: The truly free man wants only what he can do and does what he pleases.
sentences.chinese: 真正自由的人只祈求他力所能及的和做其所乐做的。

sentences.english: Help cut down on environmental waste in whatever way you can
sentences.chinese: 减少环境污染，力所能及，从我做起。

sentences.english: The Chinese embassy will continue to provide the best possible support.
sentences.chinese: 中国使馆将一如既往的提供力所能及的支持。

sentences.english: China will continue to offer Papua New Guinea assistance within its available resources.
sentences.chinese: 中方将继续在力所能及的范围内向巴新提供援助。

sentences.english: You have done what you could.
sentences.chinese: 你已经做了你力所能及的。

sentences.english: In these tough times, young people need all the help they can get.
sentences.chinese: 在这样艰难的时期，年轻人需要所有力所能及的帮助。

sentences.english: At their most self-aware, they probe the edges of the possible.
sentences.chinese: 他们最了解自己，他们在探寻力所能及的可能。

sentences.english: He then really thought himself equal to it.
sentences.chinese: 当时，他确实觉得这是他力所能及的。

sentences.english: But there needs to be at least cameo visibility for this model in this century.
sentences.chinese: 但是，至少有必要在这个世纪里做点力所能及的事情。

sentences.english: Respect the old and love the young, offer help and kindness as much as possible.
sentences.chinese: 尊老爱幼，尽可能的向别人提供力所能及的帮助。

sentences.english: We believe that the subject only undertakes commitments which can be fulfilled.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为该项目只承担了力所能及的义务。

sentences.english: Approximate the movement to the degree you can without pain. Exhale. Try again.
sentences.chinese: 估量一下自己力所能及的程度，大喝一声，再来一次。

to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost

to practice what one preaches (idiom)
